Body: Description: Our aic.log is overwhelm with errors related to expiring access to particular shares, but the user has already separated from the company (so their AD account no longer exists to remove from the share). [The description has been cut, review the attached email for details]
Next Steps Updated: Attempting to reproduce the issue in a lab.

What We've Learned Updated: Failure to remove a user from a group after it is deleted was easily reproduced, but the issue here now seems to be that its not just affecting deleted users, but the AIC service can't find some users at all, even if they exist.

What We've Learned Updated: Failure to remove a user from a group after it is deleted was easily reproduced, but the issue here now seems to be that its not just affecting deleted users, but the AIC service can't find some users at all, even if they exist.

The domains exist in the web config file, but the issue still persists.

What We've Learned Updated: Customer is using an old ProServ job (0. OnlineDC) to create a dynamic host list for the 1-AD_Scan. Even though the job says it is working successfully, the logs show it erroring out with "Unable to create host list"

We deleted the dynamic host list from the 0.OnlineDC job and recreated it. We then kicked off the 1-AD_Scan. We want to verify that the host list continues to work after the first run.
---
Failure to remove a user from a group after it is deleted was easily reproduced, but the issue here now seems to be that its not just affecting deleted users, but the AIC service can't find some users at all, even if they exist.

The domains exist in the web config file, but the issue still persists.

Next Steps Updated: We kicked off a the ADI job group at the end of our call. The customer will let us know how the scheduled scan later tonight looks and report back to us in the morning if the job is completing reoccurringly successful.

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Customer granted temporary permissions to a resource in AIC.
Customer deleted the user account that was granted temporary access.
Temporary access expired and the AIC is trying to remove access but can't find the user and keeps looping.

What We've Learned Updated: The attempt to cleanup permissions occurs every 5 minutes in the current logs.
We set the ExpirationState to 2 in the SA_AIC_ResourceAccessRequests table for each SID encountering this and monitored for 10 minutes.
The issue appears to be resolved.
Next Steps Updated: Monitoring the logs for 24 hours to ensure the issue does not return
